elements.name: Digital Identity Data
elements.documentation: Some documentation…

elements.name: Sovrin Ledger
elements.documentation: The distributed, continuously-replicated global cryptographic database of Transactions maintained by Stewards operating Nodes communicating with the Sovrin Consensus Protocol. The Sovrin Ledger consists of four subledgers: the Sovrin Config Ledger, Sovrin Node Ledger, Sovrin Domain Ledger (also called the Sovrin Main Ledger), and Sovrin Payment Ledger. Only the Sovrin Domain Ledger and Sovrin Payment Ledger accept publicly available Transaction Types. See Sovrin Ledger Access Policies and Appendix E.

elements.name: Governence
elements.documentation: Some documentation…

elements.name: Digital Identifier
elements.documentation: Some documentation…

elements.name: Decentralized Identity (DI)
elements.documentation: A digital identity is composed of a digital identifier and associated digital identity data.

elements.name: Privacy by Design
elements.documentation: A set of seven foundational principles for taking privacy into account throughout the entire design and engineering of a system, product, or service. Originally defined by the Information and Privacy Commissioner of Ontario, Canada. Specific Sovrin Privacy by Design principles are a subset of the Core Principles in the Sovrin Governance Framework.

elements.name: Core Principles
elements.documentation: The principles published in a Governance Framework that apply broadly to all Trust Community Members. The Core Principles of the Sovrin Governance Framework are defined in Section 2 of the Sovrin Governance Framework Master Document.

elements.name: Purpose
elements.documentation: The overarching goal of a Governance Framework as defined by its Governance Authority and Trust Community. The Purpose of Sovrin Infrastructure as a global public utility is defined in section 1 of the Sovrin Governance Framework.

elements.name: SSI Model
elements.documentation: The Self-Sovereign Identity Model (SSI Model) is an identity system architecture based on the core principle that Identity Owners have the right to permanently exert control over the usage of one or more of their Personal Digital Identifiers and, independently, the usage of any associated Personal Identity Data. [inspired by the Sovrin Glossary]

elements.name: Identifier
elements.documentation: Some documentation…

elements.name: Self-Sovereign Identity 2
elements.documentation: An identity system architecture based on the core principle that Identity Owners have the right to permanently control one or more Identifiers together with the usage of the associated Identity Data. The Sovrin Governance Framework specifies two types of Identity Owners: Independents, who do not need to rely on any external administrative authority; and Dependents, who need to rely on a Guardian.

elements.name: Systems Infrastructure
elements.documentation: Some documentation…
Some documentation…

elements.name: Subsidiary Ledger (Subledger)
elements.documentation: Some documentation…

elements.name: Sovrin Trustee
elements.documentation: A Trustee who is a member of the Sovrin Foundation Board of Trustees. The trust in Sovrin Trustees is bestowed collectively on behalf of all Identity Owners.

elements.name: Sovrin Infrastructure Roles
elements.documentation: The business roles defined in the Sovrin Governance Framework for each of the four Sovrin Infrastructure Layers: Sovrin Ledger Layer Roles, Agent-to-Agent Protocol Layer Roles, Credential Exchange Layer Roles, and Governance Framework Layer Roles. See Appendix D.

elements.name: SSI Protocol 2
elements.documentation: A generic version of the Sovrin Protocol that works at the second layer of the SSI Stack to enable Credential Exchange and Governance Frameworks to work interoperably across any number of SSI ledgers, blockchains, or networks.

elements.name: Decentralized Identity Domain (Layer 4) - based on accepted Decentralized Identity themes
elements.documentation: Some documentation…

elements.name: SOVRONA Level 1 Verifiable Identifier Utility Domain (Layer 5) - based on ToIP themes
elements.documentation: Some documentation…

elements.name: Jurisdiction
elements.documentation: A legally defined scope of authority to which an Identity Owner is bound by law at any one point in time. Jurisdiction is particularly relevant to Sovrin Governance Framework policies in order to help ensure diversity among Stewards. For these purposes, Jurisdiction is defined broadly as: sovereign states or autonomous regions that are members of the United Nations, any UN Specialized Agency, or the Universal Postal Union, as well as sovereign states or autonomous regions that have observer status at the UN or any UN Specialized Agency.

elements.name: Verifiable Identifiers: DIDs and Keys (Verifiable DID Documents)
